message_1: What is the heat capacity of a 25 g aluminum block if it absorbs 288 Joules of heat and its temperature rises by 15°C?
message_2:
To find the heat capacity of the aluminum block, we can use the formula:

Q = mcΔT

where Q is the heat absorbed (in Joules), m is the mass of the block (in grams), c is the specific heat capacity of aluminum (in J/g°C), and ΔT is the change in temperature (in °C).

We are given the values for Q (288 J), m (25 g), and ΔT (15°C). The specific heat capacity of aluminum, c, is 0.897 J/g°C. We can rearrange the formula to solve for the heat capacity:

c = Q / (mΔT)

Substituting the given values:

c = 288 J / (25 g × 15°C)

c = 288 J / 375 g°C

c ≈ 0.768 J/g°C

The heat capacity of the 25 g aluminum block is approximately 0.768 J/g°C.
